intro: Paraboea capitata var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, clustered white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically narrow and elliptical, with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
